intro: Isidroa spinifera, commonly known as the spiny isidroa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves, which provide a defensive mechanism against herbivores. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens. Isidroa spinifera is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
